publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-994# Dr Sylvia Jackson: Body Piercing-That the Parliament notes that body piercing carries a risk of hepatitis, HIV, cellulitis and wound infections; further notes that local authorities have introduced very different ways of regulating the industry; recognises the potential dangers of this situation; believes that an enforceable national regulatory framework to govern body piercing should be introduced, and urges the Scottish Executive to bring forward legislation to cover this industry.
S1M-994# Body Piercing (lodged on 9 June 2000) Elaine Thomson*, Malcolm Chisholm*
S1M-994# Body Piercing (lodged on 9 June 2000) Cathy Jamieson*
S1M-994# Body Piercing (lodged on 9 June 2000) Margaret Jamieson*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Mike Watson*, Trish Godman*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-994# Body Piercing (lodged on 9 June 2000) Mr John McAllion*

S1M-994# Dr Sylvia Jackson: Body Piercing—That the Parliament notes that body piercing carries a risk of hepatitis, HIV, cellulitis and wound infections; further notes that local authorities have introduced very different ways of regulating the industry; recognises the potential dangers of this situation; believes that an enforceable national regulatory framework to govern body piercing should be introduced, and urges the Scottish Executive to bring forward legislation to cover this industry. Supported by: Elaine Thomson, Malcolm Chisholm, Cathy Jamieson, Margaret Jamieson, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mike Watson, Trish Godman, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr John McAllion, Maureen Macmillan*
S1M-994# Body Piercing (lodged on 9 June 2000) Irene Oldfather*
S1M-994# Body Piercing (lodged on 9 June 2000) Pauline McNeill*
S1M-994# Body Piercing (lodged on 9 June 2000) Nora Radcliffe*, Robert Brown*, Alex Neil*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Dr Winnie Ewing*, Elaine Smith*, Karen Whitefield*

S1M-994# Dr Sylvia Jackson: Body Piercing—That the Parliament notes that body piercing carries a risk of hepatitis, HIV, cellulitis and wound infections; further notes that local authorities have introduced very different ways of regulating the industry; recognises the potential dangers of this situation; believes that an enforceable national regulatory framework to govern body piercing should be introduced, and urges the Scottish Executive to bring forward legislation to cover this industry. Supported by: Elaine Thomson, Malcolm Chisholm, Cathy Jamieson, Margaret Jamieson, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mike Watson, Trish Godman, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr John McAllion, Maureen Macmillan, Irene Oldfather, Pauline McNeill, Nora Radcliffe, Robert Brown, Alex Neil, Mr Michael McMahon, Dr Winnie Ewing, Elaine Smith, Karen Whitefield
S1M-994# Body Piercing (lodged on 9 June 2000) Fiona McLeod*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
S1M-994# Body Piercing (lodged on 9 June 2000) Scott Barrie*

S1M-994# Dr Sylvia Jackson: Body Piercing—That the Parliament notes that body piercing carries a risk of hepatitis, HIV, cellulitis and wound infections; further notes that local authorities have introduced very different ways of regulating the industry; recognises the potential dangers of this situation; believes that an enforceable national regulatory framework to govern body piercing should be introduced, and urges the Scottish Executive to bring forward legislation to cover this industry. Supported by: Elaine Thomson, Malcolm Chisholm, Cathy Jamieson, Margaret Jamieson, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mike Watson, Trish Godman, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr John McAllion, Maureen Macmillan, Irene Oldfather, Pauline McNeill, Nora Radcliffe, Robert Brown, Alex Neil, Mr Michael McMahon, Dr Winnie Ewing, Elaine Smith, Karen Whitefield, Fiona McLeod, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Scott Barrie
